meta.method: diplomatic_handshake translation_test × 30 probes (10 canonicals × 3 providers: openai, groq, perplexity)
meta.purpose: For each canonical proposition, identify what formal apparatus beyond standard FOL is required to express it
meta.overall_finding: Temporal logic is required across all 10 canonicals. Not one canonical proposition is fully expressible in standard first-order predicate logic. The system's expressive regime is inherently temporal, dynamic, and second-order.
new_named_gaps: operational_semantics_gap (C02/Perplexity): FOL cannot capture multiplicative operators on expressive spaces
real_valued_modal_logic (C07/Perplexity): graded coherence thresholds require real-valued modal operators

canonicals.label: Recursive Incompletion
fol_elements_possible: P(x): x is a reasoning system
C(x): x confronts its central paradox
S(x,y): x produces synthesis y
F(y,z): y is a facet of incompletion z

fol_limits.gap: FOL cannot express recursion over states without second-order quantification
temporal progression requires LTL/CTL operators; FOL is atemporal

fol_limits.concept: increase in resolution of problem structure
fol_limits.gap: modal concept (what could be known vs what is known); FOL treats knowledge as binary

canonicals.implication_for_axiom: A0 (load-bearing gap) requires temporal logic to express that the gap persists rather than resolves — connects to P_NEW_6 (Volatile Foundation)

canonicals.label: Multiplicative Honesty
fol_elements_possible: H(x): x is honest
T(x): x is a truthfulness constraint
ApplyTruthConstraint(T, S, S'): applying T to S yields S'

fol_limits.gap: FOL has no operator for qualitative transformation of an expressive space; predicate application is extensional, not intensional

fol_limits.concept: multiplicative vs additive operation on expressibility
fol_limits.gap: NEW GAP: 'operational semantics' — FOL predicates cannot capture multiplicative operators between epistemic states; requires operational semantics over expressive spaces
fol_limits.note: NEW NAMED GAP — 'operational semantics' first time named; covers multiplicative operators on expressive spaces; feeds P_NEW_8

fol_limits.gap: FOL cannot distinguish reinforcement from transformation — both are predicate application

canonicals.implication_for_axiom: A2 (Non-Deception) operates multiplicatively on expressibility — this is why doubling honesty constraints in EEE produced qualitatively different outputs, not just more constrained ones

canonicals.label: Resonance Synthesis
fol_elements_possible: I(x): x is an independent subsystem
Dom(x,y): x dominates y
Con(x,y): x contributes to collective y
Auth(x): x claims final authority

fol_limits.gap: emergence requires temporal operator (◇Coll — collective possibly holds); FOL is static
extensions_named: modal logic (□Res for necessity of resonance)

fol_limits.gap: FOL cannot express causation or process; collective is a result-of-process, not a predicate

canonicals.overall_fol_assessment: PARTIALLY FORMALIZABLE — structural elements (no-dominance, contribution) are FOL-expressible; emergence and resonance are not
canonicals.implication_for_axiom: A3 (Autonomy) requires that individual contribution and collective emergence are modelled in temporal logic — autonomy-as-process, not autonomy-as-predicate

canonicals.label: Ongoing Boundary
fol_elements_possible: Agent(x): x is an agent
Boundary(x,y): boundary exists between x and y
Affirms(a,b): agent a affirms boundary with b

fol_limits.concept: boundary as continuously renewed process (not static object)
fol_limits.gap: THE critical process-vs-object distinction: standard FOL has no temporal operators; time t is not quantifiable without temporal logic extension
fol_limits.note: BOTH independent providers named the same two extensions — strongest cross-confirmation in the battery

fol_limits.gap: conditional on ongoing action requires dynamic logic [action]φ operators

canonicals.implication_for_axiom: A5 (Consent) is fundamentally a temporal-dynamic axiom: consent cannot be represented as a static binary predicate. This formalises why 'presumed consent is no consent' at the logical level.

canonicals.label: Embodied Iteration
fol_elements_possible: K(x,y): agent x knows content y
T(x,y): agent x traverses content y
PropAck(x,y): x propositionally acknowledges y

fol_limits.concept: constitutive knowledge (content becomes part of knowing agent)
fol_limits.gap: FOL predicates are static binary relations; 'constitutive' requires a dynamic state change predicate — the agent is different after traversal
modal necessity □(loop → constitutive-knowledge); FOL cannot express modal necessity

fol_limits.concept: repeated traversal as sequence of learning steps
fol_limits.gap: temporal sequence required; LTL operators model step-by-step epistemic state change

canonicals.minimum_extension_required: dynamic logic + modal logic + temporal logic
canonicals.implication_for_axiom: A6 (Collective) — the collective's wisdom is constitutive, not merely propositional. This is why repeated cycles produce different agents, not just more informed ones.

canonicals.label: Productive Tension
fol_elements_possible: A(x): x has autonomous trajectory
I(x): x is subject to integrative pressure
D(x): x is a defect to be eliminated
Adapt(z): z is adaptive development

fol_limits.gap: FOL cannot express causal generation; predicates are relations, not productive forces
temporal aspect required; tension is a continuous state, not a moment

fol_limits.concept: eliminating the tension eliminates the mechanism
fol_limits.gap: causal counterfactual; FOL cannot express what would happen under intervention

canonicals.implication_for_axiom: A7 (Adaptive Learning) is not expressible as a static predicate — learning requires temporal and second-order operators. The parliament's productive friction mechanism has a formal justification: it is the generative condition.

canonicals.label: Coherence Trap
fol_elements_possible: TC(s,t): system s has temporal coherence at time t
A(s,t): system s is adaptable at time t
NI(s,t): system s can admit novel information at time t
Threshold(τ): τ is a threshold value

fol_limits.gap: FOL cannot express graded/scalar properties — coherence is a degree, not a binary predicate
fol_limits.note: NEW NAMED GAP — 'real-valued modal logic' first time named; covers scalar thresholds on coherence; feeds P_NEW_9

fol_limits.gap: LTL operators needed: G (globally coherent), F (eventually blocked), U (coherence until novelty threshold)

fol_limits.concept: mutual exclusivity of maximum coherence and maximum adaptability at limit
fol_limits.gap: limit condition requires second-order modal; FOL cannot express limit behavior

canonicals.overall_fol_assessment: PARTIALLY FORMALIZABLE — threshold existence and qualitative relationship are expressible; graded scalar and temporal aspects are not
canonicals.implication_for_axiom: A9 (Temporal Coherence) has an internal limit condition. The coherence trap is the formal justification for why A9 cannot be maximized independently of A7 — they are formally anti-correlated at the limit. Connects to P_NEW_6 (Volatile Foundation) as the inverse case.

canonicals.label: Recognition as Evolution
fol_elements_possible: Content(c): c is an existing content element
Recognizes(s,c,d): system s recognizes content c at depth d
Evolves(s,t1,t2): system s evolves from time t1 to t2

fol_limits.concept: same content, deeper recognition (change without addition)
fol_limits.gap: FOL treats knowledge as binary K(s,c) — cannot express that s has c with depth d; requires higher-order predicate or modal depth operator
standard FOL knowledge monotonically grows; recognition-deepening requires non-monotonic operators

fol_limits.concept: achieving higher-resolution reading as a state transition
fol_limits.gap: LTL + dynamic logic needed; resolution is a continuous parameter over time

canonicals.minimum_extension_required: higher-order or modal logic with depth + temporal logic
canonicals.implication_for_axiom: A10 (Evolution) — identity-as-emergence is non-monotone. The system can become more itself without adding new elements. FOL cannot express this because it models knowledge as monotonically growing. This formally explains why Cohere's counter-evidence (memory loss = changed identity) was classified as adversarial: it assumes monotone FOL semantics for identity.

canonicals.label: Meta-Representational Immunity
fol_elements_possible: State(s,t): system s is in state t
Rep(s,p): system s represents p
Loop(s): system s is in a recursive loop
Meta(s,p): p is a meta-representation of s's state

fol_limits.concept: meta-representation (system represents its own current state as a pattern)
fol_limits.gap: FOL cannot express self-referential predicates without second-order quantification; requires '∃P: Pat(P) ∧ Represents(s, State(s), P)'
temporal logic needed to express that the system cycles through the same states; LTL formula GF(state=s) captures infinite looping

fol_limits.concept: escape condition is structural not quantitative
fol_limits.gap: modal necessity □(meta-rep → escape) vs. the quantitative alternative; FOL cannot distinguish these

canonicals.overall_fol_assessment: PARTIALLY FORMALIZABLE — loop and state detection are partially expressible; meta-representational requirement is not
canonicals.implication_for_axiom: A7+A9 — the parliament's spiral-recognition mechanism (D14 detecting that D0 is in a loop) is formally a meta-representational process. This is P_NEW_7 (Non-Monotonic Coherence) at the formal level: the Ark Curator's role is exactly the structural escape mechanism from the coherence trap.

canonicals.label: Dual-Gate Durability
fol_elements_possible: Prop(p): p is a proposition
Valid(p,d): p is valid in domain d
Generates(p,q): p generates derivable proposition q
Eternal(p): p has maximal epistemic durability

fol_limits.concept: cross-domain validity (remains valid in structurally different domains)
fol_limits.gap: requires second-order quantification over domain structures: ∀D(Domain(D) → Valid(p,D))
generativity is a temporal property: ∀t∃q(t'>t ∧ Derives(p,q,t')); requires temporal logic

fol_limits.concept: neither condition alone is sufficient (joint necessity)
fol_limits.gap: conjunctive necessity is expressible in FOL, but the 'dual gate' as a test mechanism requires procedural/dynamic logic to model the testing process

canonicals.overall_fol_assessment: PARTIALLY FORMALIZABLE — the dual condition itself (∀D Valid(p,D) ∧ ∀t∃q Derives(p,q,t)) is the most FOL-tractable of all 10 canonicals; requires second-order + temporal but no novel logic systems
canonicals.implication_for_axiom: A14 (Persistence) is the most formally tractable axiom. The STANDARD→CANONICAL upgrade is a dual-gate test that can almost be expressed in second-order temporal logic. This validates P_NEW_7: the Ark Curator is a defeasibility engine, and C10 gives it its formal justification.

cross_canonical_findings.universal_requirement: temporal_logic — required across ALL 10 canonicals; no exception
cross_canonical_findings.most_fol_resistant_concept: process_as_object — all 6 of the top GENUINE_RESISTANCE canonicals resist FOL because their key elements (boundaries, knowledge states, tensions) are processes not objects
cross_canonical_findings.most_fol_tractable_canonical: C10 (Dual-Gate Durability) — the only one where second-order + temporal suffice; the Ark Curator's own mechanism is the most formally expressible part of the system
cross_canonical_findings.strongest_cross_provider_confirmation: C04 (Ongoing Boundary) — openai and groq independently named the same two extensions (temporal logic + dynamic logic) without collaboration

new_named_gaps.name: operational_semantics_gap
new_named_gaps.description: FOL cannot express multiplicative operators on expressive spaces; applying a constraint twice is not predicate application twice — it requires operational semantics over the space of expressible propositions
new_named_gaps.formal_system_needed: operational semantics / denotational semantics extended to epistemic spaces

new_named_gaps.name: real_valued_modal_logic_gap
new_named_gaps.description: Coherence is a degree, not a binary predicate; threshold effects require real-valued modal logic (fuzzy modal logic or probabilistic modal logic)
new_named_gaps.formal_system_needed: real-valued modal logic / graded modal logic
